title: Ornament, 1859–65
creditline: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund
description: "a": Oval motif in the Neo-Renaissance style imitating brown wooden carved and turned openwork. At center, a console ornamented with gold supporting a grisaille group of hounds attacking a stag. Sepia putti, top and sides; "b": Similar motif with console supporting grisaille wolf caught in a trap.  At top an eagle attacks a swan-like bird. Same color scheme as "a".

tombstone.epitaph:
Ornament, 1859–65.
1859–65. Block-printed on machine-made paper. Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund. 1955-12-10-a,b.
